comments:
Copy a file in a remote directory, and then right click on this remote directory and choose Paste
Got "Duplicate Name Collision" dialog.

I chose Overwrite, and press OK.
Got error for Problem Occurred:
Transfer Operation (Time of error: May 15, 2007 4:40:21 PM EDT)
Reason: Invalid thread access.

Fixed any such "invalid thread access" issues once and for all in SystemMessageDialog, by doing a Display.getDefault().syncExec() in case it is not already called on the Display thread.

[187115] force SystemMessageDialog always into Display thread

Please Verify -- the fact that an error message should have been displayed might indicate that some other problem was hidden by this bug.
*** Bug 187096 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

The original problem (got "Invalid thread access" error) had been fixed in RSE-SDK-I20070514-1630 driver.  

But I still got error:

RSE1306E: Copy of file or folder epdcdump01.hex failed.
Details: The file system reported the copy operation failed.  You may not have authority to the target folder, or it maybe in use.

But if I copied this file outside the folder, and then copied it and pasted it back to the folder, I did not get this error.  
It seems the error only happened when I copied a file and pasted it back to the folder it belonged to.

Xuan, I believe that Javier fixed this in a later driver. Can you please try with I20070517-0600 and if you still see it, re-open this bug or file a new one if you think it's a different issue than the one originally handled by this bug.
I tried this and it works with todays driver.

I just tried RSE-SDK-I20070517-0600.zip driver, but this problem has not been totally fixed yet.

In my folder, I had two files, one was a .txt file, and one is a .zip file.

I copied the .txt file and then pasted it back to it parent folder.
Got the dialog for overwrite.  I clicked OK, and it was fine.
Then I copied the .zip file, also pasted it back to its parent folder.
Got the dialog for overwriting.  I click OK, and I got the same error as before again.
Now, if I copied the .txt file and pasted it back to the parent directory, I got the same error as before.

Copying a file from one folder and trying to paste it back to that folder will cause an error.  cp on linux won't let you do that as well as xcopy.  

On Linux:
cp: `Testing.txt' and `/home2/kjdoyle/testing/Testing.txt' are the same file

On Windows:
File cannot be copied onto itself.

Ideally overwrite should be disabled on the dialog that appears.

I see what Xuan is talking about and I tried to do a couple of tests myself.  What I have found from this seems to be pretty normal behaviour as commented by Kevin.  Maybe changing the error message that is produced would be better to inform the user of what is occuring.  

Instance1:
It seems that when you try and copy and paste the file from and to the parent directory and error is produced saying:

"Copy of the file or folder rupen failed"  

Details : "The file system reported the copy operation failed. You may not have authority to the target folder, or it may be in use"

Which in my opinion seems normal because the user is attempting to copy and paste the file to and from the exact same location (which would never really have to be done).

Instance2:
The second instance when the file is first copied to another folder and then copied over to the parent directory from there makes sense.  It's just a simple overwrite where the two files can have the same name but different contents. In the first instance the both files have the same content becuase they are the same file from the same location.
The original problem here (with the invalid thread access) was fixed so I think we should close this and open an enhancement for providing a better error message.
Closing since this problem was fixed.
Verified the invalid thread access problem has been fixed in 0713 2.0.1 driver.
